image.altText: A close-up of an Indigenous ranger looking through binoculars.

props.synopsis: Foreign fishers illegally entering Australian waters have been caught in their dozens in the Top End in the past 12 months, marking a concerning spike for rangers.

title.children: In Australia's north, rangers are battling a 'matter of national security'

image.altText: Emergency hospital sing with hospital building in background

props.synopsis: A falling palm tree has struck and killed a seven-year-old girl playing in a Darwin backyard, in what's been described as "a freak" accident.

title.children: Falling palm tree kills seven-year-old girl in 'freak' accident

image.altText: Bradley John Murdoch

props.synopsis: Bradley Murdoch spent the rest of his life in prison after being convicted of murdering British backpacker Peter Falconio. Those who knew him behind bars say he was a "lone wolf" and a master manipulator, who was uncooperative until the end.

title.children: Inmates and guards shed light on the real Bradley Murdoch behind bars

image.altText: Aircraft sit at the gates of Darwin International Airport.

props.synopsis: The operators of Darwin's airport have raised its landing fees by more than 110 per cent, with some airlines already increasing passenger ticket prices in response.

title.children: Darwin airport hikes fees to 'more than double' anywhere else in Australia

image.altText: View of mountains in a golden yellow colour, hazy sky in the horizon.

props.synopsis: Northern Territory Parks is reminding hikers to carry personal location devices and be well prepared when they head into the outback.

title.children: Larapinta Trail hikers urged caution after two rescues in one week

image.altText: A man in handcuffs.

props.synopsis: Conspiracy theories about the murder of Peter Falconio dogged his family and girlfriend Joanne Lees for as long as Bradley Murdoch denied his guilt. So where does the truth lie?

title.children: Was Bradley Murdoch guilty? Court transcripts and experts reveal the evidence

image.altText: Australian Army Helicopter

props.synopsis: An Australian Army helicopter participating in the multinational Talisman Sabre exercise in the Northern Territory has been damaged in a "hard landing".

title.children: Australian Army helicopter damaged in 'hard landing' during war drills

image.altText: An Aboriginal women accepts a medal from the Governor-General, with an image of Yunupingu displayed prominently behind her.

props.synopsis: One of Australia's most influential Aboriginal leaders has posthumously received the nation's highest civilian honour.

title.children: Dr Yunupiŋu posthumously awarded Australia's highest civilian honour

image.altText: Tim Tszyu reacts after losing a super welterweight title boxing match against Sebastian Fundora, holding his head in left hand

props.synopsis: Australian super welterweight Tim Tszyu has lost his rematch against Sebastian Fundora, failing to come out for the eighth round at the MGM Grand in Las Vegas. Follow live.

title.children: 'I just couldn't do it': Tszyu quits on his stool in title fight

image.altText: Jeremy Cameron celebrates a goal

props.synopsis: After being stunned by St Kilda earlier this season, Geelong looks to settle the score as it hosts the Saints at Kardinia Park hoping to get back into the top four. Follow live.

title.children: Cameron on track for huge haul as Cats and Saints exchange miracle goals

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Collingwood vs Fremantle team news: No late changes
Wood with his own magical dribble!

image.altText: Tino

props.synopsis: The Gold Coast Titans are at Leichhardt Oval for a clash with the Tigers that could go a long way towards deciding who finishes last in NRL season 2025. Follow live.

title.children: Tigers face Titans in potential Spoon Bowl

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Phil Sami gets one back for the Titans
30' Tino Fa'asuamaleaui is off the field

image.altText: Melbourne Vixens goal keeper Rudi Ellis sitting on the bench, bleeding from a cut above the eye

props.synopsis: The Adelaide Thunderbirds attempt to keep their hopes of a three-peat alive, hosting the Melbourne Vixens in the Super Netball minor semifinal. Follow live.

title.children: Vixens lead semifinal after GK was cut in warm-up by teammate's elbow

image.altText: A screenshot of two people in an intimate embrace looking shocked

props.synopsis: Tech CEO Andy Byron resigns after being caught in an embrace with his company's chief people officer at a Coldplay concert.

title.children: Astronomer CEO Andy Byron resigns after Coldplay concert saga

image.altText: a hand holds a vape with neon coloured pink, purple and orange vapour

props.synopsis: Inside the world of vaping, where influencers, big tobacco and the black market stare down vape reforms and users hunting for a fix.

title.children: How influencers, big tobacco and the black market fight back against vape reforms

image.altText: Ken Henry #1

props.synopsis: Ken Henry, a former treasury secretary, says the media has to hold Australia's political system accountable for its policy failures

title.children: Ken Henry wants Australia's media to do a better job

image.altText: A man stands on a tourist boat that capsized in Ha Long Bay

props.synopsis: The vessel was carrying 48 passengers and five crew members when it capsized on Saturday because of sudden heavy rain.

title.children: Dozens dead after tourist boat capsizes in Ha Long Bay

image.altText: A diver wearing scuba gear holds a triangular stone up to the camera, illuminated by soft light streaming through the water.

props.synopsis: For years, researchers have been trying to find ancient artefacts sitting on the ocean floor. Now they have brought in Indigenous rangers to help.

title.children: Survey of Australia's seabed turns up 'lost' archaeological treasures

image.altText: Orange virus particles on a white and green dotted background

props.synopsis: Queensland Health says contact tracing is underway for the overseas-acquired case and the public "should not be concerned".

title.children: Second Australian case of new mpox strain detected in Queensland

image.altText: A city skyline, including a bridge and several large buildings.

props.synopsis: Concerns are growing that Kazakhstan could be at risk of a future Russian invasion, amid claims of the Kremlin's growing influence and signs of a cultural crackdown.

title.children: After Ukraine, this country could be Putin's next target for invasion

image.altText: An aerial proposal shot of a group of islands on the ocean

props.synopsis: If you believe the hype, cities may float, fly, or stretch for miles by 2050, with proposed plans, including sky gardens, solar walls, glow in the dark sand, drone commuting and spaceports.

title.children: Futuristic cities shaped by billionaires and corporations

image.altText: A group of backpackers playing volley ball on the beach with a sunset behind them.

props.synopsis: Hostels and hospitality venues along the north Queensland coast are booming with pre-pandemic levels of backpackers while the outback misses out.

title.children: Coastal backpacker boom leaves outback short of workers

image.altText: Detective Superintendent Jason Box looks sideways

props.synopsis: In more than 30 years on the NSW Police force, Detective Superintendent Jason Box has never seen a Sydney gangland war like this one.

title.children: Sydney's gangland war unlike any ever seen by head of taskforce

image.altText: An electric vehicle ultra rapid charging station with a car parked in front.

props.synopsis: The RAC in Western Australia pulls the plug on its "electric-highway" project, 10 years after it pioneered regional electric vehicle-charging networks.

title.children: End of the road for Australia's first electric vehicle-charging project

image.altText: Billy Joel, wearing a leather jacket and dark sunglasses, scowls at the camera.

props.synopsis: This two-part, five-hour epic is essential viewing for anyone who's ever wanted to know more about one of pop's most guarded stars.

title.children: After 55 years, Billy Joel finally lets his guard down in 5-hour documentary

image.altText: Ben Donaldson being tackled by the Lions.

props.synopsis: Wallabies coach Joe Schmidt admits his side was off the pace in its 27-19 loss to the British and Irish Lions, but expressed pride in the Australians' refusal to give up.

title.children: Wallabies to assess damage of Lions Test loss in the 'cold light of day'

image.altText: Three young men walk away from an aid distribution site, each carrying two heavy plastic bottles filled with water

props.synopsis: Gaza's health ministry says at least 36 people were killed by Israeli fire while on their way to an aid distribution site in Gaza.

title.children: Israeli fire kills dozens seeking aid in Gaza, hospital says

image.altText: A chart showing flu cases with a picture of a woman blowing her nose

props.synopsis: It feels like every year we're told this is one of the worst flu seasons on record. But this time around, doctors really mean it.

title.children: Feel like everyone is sick this year? Here’s why

image.altText: Jacinta Allan appears serious, standing inside.

props.synopsis: Premier Jacinta Allan's government has defied a deadline set by Victoria's parliament to publish documents detailing the state's childcare crisis.

title.children: Victorian childcare crisis data remains secret after missed deadline

image.altText: A silhouette of a man leans over a fishing pot on a boat, a glowy orange sunset reflects on the ocean behind him

props.synopsis: Four months after a toxic algal bloom was first detected off South Australia's coastlines, business owners on the Yorke Peninsula say they are in dire need of support if they are to survive the ongoing marine disaster.

title.children: Algal bloom impact 'like something you'd see in a horror movie', fisher says

image.altText: Two elderly women stand together, smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: Wendy Pope and Esme Rash, both in their 90s, have remained firm friends for more than four decades.

title.children: Friends for 40 years, nonagenarians share what is their 'spice of life'

image.altText: A silver car with a broken tail light crashed into a pole at night.

props.synopsis: A car rams a crowd of people waiting to enter a nightclub along a busy boulevard in Los Angeles, injuring 30 people and leading bystanders to attack the driver, according to authorities.

title.children: Man whose car struck crowd outside Los Angeles club was shot, police say

image.altText: A deer with antlers walks through dense WA bushland.

props.synopsis: A team of sharpshooters in helicopters will fly over properties in southern Western Australia, using thermal cameras to spot feral deer.

title.children: Targeted aerial cull to 'nip in the bud' WA's growing feral deer problem

image.altText: Crops growing on a farm on a sunny day in winter

props.synopsis: Rain brings some relief to drought-affected farmers in Victoria, but most of the state is still desperately dry.

title.children: Crops on a 'knife edge' in Victoria as drought continues to bite

image.altText: A woman in the distance walking over a hill with an old ruined car.

props.synopsis: Most Australian indie films disappear after they do the festival circuit, but a creative director says Aussie movies should be given "a leg up" with a quota system in cinemas.

title.children: Independent filmmaker's $100k spend and 'huge journey of self-belief'

image.altText: Jess Hull runs on the track during a race

props.synopsis: Olympic silver medallist Jess Hull sets an Oceanian and Australian national mile record while finishing runner-up at the London Diamond League meeting.

title.children: Jess Hull breaks Australian mile record at London Diamond League meet
